intro: Haplopappus pappocromus, commonly known as the silverleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in prairies and open woodlands. It produces fluffy, wind-dispersed seeds that aid in its propagation. Haplopappus pappocromus is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting local pollinators.
